content.description: The Upper Pivot Traverse is as what the name implies.  Climb back and forth just off the ground or make up your own variation.  I like to start at Butt Crack and work right on crimpy moves before raping down and around into the alcove.  Then keep going till you run out of cliff and turn around like in pong.
content.protection: No protection required for the Upper Pivot Traverse becasus of a nice flat landing zone but a crash pad is optional.

content.description: Climb the seam.  There were no bolts on this as of 5/24/13
This route is the right most climb located at Upper Pivot Point.  There is an anchor at the top with a number of similarly graded ways to get to it.
content.protection: There is an anchor on the upper slab.

content.description: The most obvious climb as you pop out of the trail to the rock face.  Great first sport lead as it is rather safe for the highway.  Bring slings for the anchor as it is just two bolts.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location: Just right of the corner of the formation.

content.description: This route is just right of elite eight and pretty much straight up.Same as elite eight, the crux is in the first few feet.
content.protection: TR from same anchor of Elite Eight

content.description: A fun hand crack on the backside of the formation. Great first trad lead too. Easy free solo if that is your thing.
content.protection: .3-#3 Camalots allows you to place every 2 feet.  Great first trad lead.
content.location: Once you pop out on the trail at the formation it is around the left side of the rock.  Easily identifiable by the large hand crack.

content.description:
Butt Cheek starts on the steep, crimp face just to the right of Butt Crack.  Shake out on a ledge half way up the route.  From here push on up through the top of the cliff clipping a lone bolt up high or using this bolt as a directional on a top rope setup.  Some webbing may be nice for reducing rope drag at the anchor. 

  LOCATION   Climb the face just right of Butt Crack.
content.protection: Butt Check is protected by one bolt and a 2 bolt chain anchor.

content.description: Shorter more moderate climbs in a nice quiet area.
